intro: Aspidostemon dorrii, commonly known as the Dorrii's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique morphological features. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers that appear in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in arid gardens.
